N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 506.1 - Background and intent

State Regulations
(a) The purpose of
these regulations is to establish standards and methods for determining rates
of payment made by government agencies pursuant to title 11 of article 5 of the

Social Services Law for case management services provided by intensive case
management, supportive case management and blended ICM/SCM case management
programs to active clients identified as persons with serious mental illness
and enrolled with a provider of services. (b) In order to be eligible for payments
pursuant to title 11 of article 5 of the Social Services Law, an intensive case
management, supportive case management or blended ICM/SCM case management
program must meet the requirements of its agreement with the Office of Mental

Health or the local governmental unit in addition to the requirements of title
XIX of the Social Security Act as identified in section
502.2
(d) of this

Title and 18 NYCRR
505.16. (c) The
rates of payment established according to these regulations are intended to be
adequate to meet the costs of an efficiently operated program. (d) Notwithstanding any other provision of
the law, case management services may be authorized by the designated case
manager assigned to individuals comprising the populations as defined in
section
506.4
of this Part and pursuant to
criteria established by the commissioner and approved by the Director of the

Budget. Notes
